DOC.brief_summary: The Mynx Vascular Closure Device ( Mynx M5 ) sponge-like material use close hole artery patient undergo diagnostic endovascular procedure
DOC.brief_title: Mynx M5 One Hour Ambulation Study
DOC.detailed_description: Key Inclusion : 1 . Patients > 18 yrs age 2 . Patient underwent percutaneous diagnostic procedure utilize 5F procedural sheath via common femoral artery . 3 . Patient able ambulate ( routinely walk 6 meter 20 foot without assistance reason ) assess investigator .
DOC.criteria: Patient > 18 year age Patient underwent percutaneous diagnostic procedure utilize 5F procedural sheath common femoral artery Patient inform understands nature study provide write INformed COnsent approve appropriate Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) prior enrollment Patient able ambulate ( routinely walk 6 meter 20 foot without assistance reason ) assess investigator PreProcedure Exclusion Criteria Patient prior surgical procedure , PTA , stent placement , vascular graft common femoral artery Patient bleed disorder thrombocytopenia Patient uncontrolled hypertension Patient morbidly obese ( BMI > 40 kg/m2 Patient pregnant lactate Patient document INR > 1.5 patient currently receive glycoprotein IIb/IIIa platelet inhibitor Patient know severe allergy contrast medium Patient know allergy PEG Patient unable ambulate one hour secondary comorbid condition Patient know require extend hospitalization rehospitalization ( e.g.patient undergo coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery ) patient schedule CABG surgery < 30 day follow procedure IntraProcedure Exclusion Criteria Common femoral artery < 5mm diameter Patient clinically significant peripheral vascular disease vicinity puncture Puncture site locate inferior border inferior epigastric artery ( IEA ) and/or inguinal ligament base upon bony landmark Patient posterior puncture multiple puncture attempt gain access Patient ipsilateral venous sheath Patient preexist arterial bleed/extravasation identify preprocedure femoral arteriogram , hematoma , pseudoaneurysm arteriovenous fistula present prior sheath removal Patient intraprocedural bleeding around access site prior sheath removal
